title: Mohamed Salah put on special training regime as Liverpool stars limber up for Man Utd
text:

Mohamed Salah has been put on an individual training regime in order to get up to speed for Liverpool's visit to Manchester United on Sunday.

The Egyptian attacker sustained an ankle injury in the closing moments of the 2-1 victory over Leicester City earlier this month following a challenge from Foxes midfielder Hamza Choudhury.

Jurgen Klopp hit out at the nature of the tackle following the game, but although he limped off the field Salah managed to avoid serious injury.

The forward is now expected to start against Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men at Old Trafford, where Liverpool look as though they'll also have two more returning stars available.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

Alisson Becker has been stepping up his recovery during the international break, and will make his first appearance since the opening weekend of the season on Sunday.

The Brazilian sustained a calf injury in the 4-1 win over Norwich City on August 9, with stand-in stopper Adrian featuring for every minute of Liverpool's Premier League campaign since.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

The former West Ham man has impressed as he's helped Liverpool to eight wins out of eight to pull eight points clear at the top of the Premier League table, but he will bow out once the Brazil No.1 returns.

Joel Matip was also seen in action at Melwood on Tuesday, with the Cameroonian defender poised to return after missing the last two games with a knock.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

The centre-back was absent for the Champions League win over Red Bull Salzburg and the Leicester victory, but now looks set to reunite with Virgil van Dijk in the centre of defence at the weekend.

Some of Liverpool's international stars have been given extended breaks following their exertions around the globe, with Roberto Firmino, Fabinho and Sadio Mane all scheduled to return to Melwood later this week.
description: The Egyptian has recovered from the ankle injury he sustained in the win over Leicester City
